wiki.content: The Brendan's Death Song Songfacts says: Following the departure of guitarist John Frusciante in 2009, the Red Hot Chili Peppers recruited longtime associate Josh Klinghoffer to replace him. Klinghoffer began writing and jamming with the band on October 12, 2009, the same day that Brendan Mullen - the LA nightclub owner who gave the band their first break - passed away. This ballad is a tribute to Mullen. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The Brendan's Death Song Songfacts says: Following the departure of guitarist John Frusciante in 2009, the Red Hot Chili Peppers recruited longtime associate Josh Klinghoffer to replace him. Klinghoffer began writing and jamming with the band on October 12, 2009, the same day that Brendan Mullen - the LA nightclub owner who gave the band their first break - passed away. This ballad is a tribute to Mullen.

track.name: Brendan's Death Song
comments:
This always has been and always will be song of a true friendship to me. He loved him so much, he meant so much to him. He doesn't sing 'I'm so sorry for you are gone, please, come back', but he sings about all good things he did, about how an amazing person he was. In this song, he doesn't sing he regrets all those things he will never do with him, he is glad for what they experienced together. 
That's why this song always makes me cry, it's the best song about friendship I have ever heard.
So glad I met you to walk the line <3
Pra mim é a melhor do álbum.
Only truly decent song on I'm With You.
Muito massa essa música! O clipe me dá vontade de chorar...

Red Hot Chili Peppers - Brendan's Death Song [Extended Music Video] 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X6YbVCyXs98

And the new video..http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=smu6_m3FNMI 
A piece of art !! Brendan would be proud !!
Here's the peculiar burial for the music video of this song: http://tienesqueescucharesto.blogspot.com/2012/06/red-hot-chili-peppers-brendan-deaths.html
Listening to this song I always think about Brandon Lee. [2]
Brendan Mullen
If he would've wrote all the songs to the quality of this one, Josh would've really deserved his place in RHCP.
let me die, so when it's time to live, another son will rise...
One of those songs that gets better the more you listen to it - by the way: great job by Flea and Chad in the louder part
and when the drummer drums he's going to play my song to carry me along...
muito massa
A melhor musica para mim *_*
amazing
Best Songs of 2011: http://aircoreyell.wordpress.com/2011/12/09/best-songs-of-2011-31-40/
perfection
BEST SONG!
